pull_request.title: Stateful sigs secret key storage callback
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Added capability to write secret key to file.
1. Create secret key
2. Generate key pair and set app specific context associated with the secret key. This context is used when updating the secret key.
3. Secret key is updated after each sign operation.
4. App manages the context and deletes associated memory when the key is deleted

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: CI: Add ci for VS/msvc build
pull_request.body:
This add ci test for code generated by msvc. 

The full detail is [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/256#issuecomment-1727750617)

It captured a new error by the test msvc_native:
```
test 4
    Start 4: oqs_tlssig

4: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_tlssig.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test/tmp"
4: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build
4: Environment variables:
4:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
4:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
4: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
4: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
4/5 Test #4: oqs_tlssig .......................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink

test 5
    Start 5: oqs_endecode

5: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_endecode.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf"
5: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test
5: Environment variables:
5:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
5:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
5: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
5: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
5/5 Test #5: oqs_endecode .....................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink


0% tests passed, 5 tests failed out of 5
```

All the tests have the same error

review.body:
Thanks for adding this MSVC CI! Besides the separate comment nit, it should pass before merge, so looking at things without much Windows knowledge:

> All the tests have the same error

googling found [this](https://github.com/confluentinc/confluent-kafka-dotnet/issues/1708#issuecomment-998689196): Worthwhile (necessary?) adding this "applink.c" to the test programs? It feels pretty weird having to do this for something testing a DLL, but then again, I don't "get" Windows....

pull_request.title: updated (O)IDs for interop test branch
pull_request.body:
This updates (O)IDs pursuant the `liboqs` changes to Kyber and Dilithium in the "standard" branch as discussed in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1537#issuecomment-1729399245.

Documentation generation excluded due to an upstream problem.

review.body:
> This fixes the cmake flag so it generates the right lib dependencies for msvc build. Otherwise, ths VS would complain about: **LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'ws2_32.lib gdi32.lib crypt32.lib'**

Thanks for this contribution! Just one question: Why did VS CI tests pass even without this PR (separating the libs by " ")? Can you point to some documentation requiring the ";"as per this improvement? I'm approving as I don't have any real experience with VS development and assume you do have more.

pull_request.title: Fix OQS_ADDL_SOCKET_LIBS setting for cmake
pull_request.body:
This fixes the cmake flag so it generates the right lib dependencies for msvc build. Otherwise, ths VS would complain about:
**LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'ws2_32.lib gdi32.lib crypt32.lib'**

pull_request.title: CI & cmake changes
pull_request.body:
Fully implement CI jobs for building under VS environment
Align the cmake test file with the VS generator.

NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.

review.body:
> NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/256 then make this pr.

I'm not quite sure what you mean: Does #263 add to & improve the changes in #256? If so, we could simply close #256 and only merge #263, right? I was holding back #256 because of your final comment "Not final solution".

Otherwise things LGTM with two single comments where I'd appreciate feedback to properly understand things. Also waiting for CI to complete. Thanks very much for this work!
